text: My name's Pete Werner.
I'm the head of AI at Leonardo AI.
We're a small and growing startup.
We've had an explosion in our user base,
so we launched about 12 months ago.
We've already got millions of users

and there's a lot of demand,
and it's very, very hard
to get capacity to run our workloads.

And also cost, I think,
was also a priority,
can be very expensive.
AWS has a product called Inferentia,

which is a specific hardware
accelerator for generative AI
or AI inference.
And the AWS Inferentia

was at a very appealing
price performance profile.

Together we built a service
that does text to image,

image generation, and
so you type in the text
of what you would like to see a picture of
and it will generate that image for you.

It lowered our cost for
inference and to serve jobs
by about 50 to 30%, which is quite a lot
because we do a lot of jobs.

I think the other benefits are
the availability of capacity.
With our existing fleet of accelerators,
we had fixed capacity

and with Inferentia there's
more opportunities to scale in

and scale out, and so we can
provision additional hosts

at our busiest times
and then turn them off

and not have to pay for them
when things get quieter.

I think for our employees,
our technical teams,
it's a new technology.
It's really cool, and we really enjoyed
kind of learning about it
and playing with it and exploring it.

For our end customers, I think
it means faster job times,
so they'll get their images back faster
than they would otherwise.

I think potentially down
the line we'll be able

to offer our best features
to our free users as well,
so they'll get to experience them.
